column2: Return to Dumnonia

Your father, the great Uther Pendragon, King of Dumnonia, has died, leaving your clubfooted infant nephew Mordred as King of Dumnonia. Following on the oaths made in your name, you have returned to Dumnonia to protect the kingdom and your nephew's inheritance from those who would sunder the realm apart. Eagerly received by those who see you as their saviour in this time of strife and uncertainty, you have been appointed Lord of Durnac by the current regent.
Dumnonia shall not fall!
Death of King Uther Pendragon

Uther Pendragon, King of Dumnonia, is dead. The only legitimate heir to the throne, Mordred, is a clubfooted child. Upon receiving news of his father's death, Uther's bastard son, Arthur, has returned from the kingdom of Benoic and has been appointed Lord of Durnac by the current regent.
Hail to King Mordred and Lord Arthur!
Let us hope Arthur will drive the Saxons back to the sea!
We will conquer their lands, no matter who is leading them...
This is interesting news...
Arthur Returns to Dumnonia

Upon receiving news of his father's death, King Uther's bastard son, Arthur, has returned to Dumnonia from the kingdom of Benoic, where he was sent by Uther to assist King Ban in his wars against the Franks. Upon arrival, Arthur has been appointed Lord of Durnac by your current regent.
A loyal vassal... or is he plotting for my throne?

With a child on the throne and enemies surrounding it on all sides, Dumnonia has never been in a greater need of a strong ruler. While most people have faith in your ability to administer the kingdom in Mordred's place, many are looking at Arthur, Uther's bastard son, as Dumnonia's only hope in these troubled times. Perhaps it would be better to leave the regency to him?

With a child on the throne and enemies surrounding it on all sides, Dumnonia has never been in a greater need of a strong ruler. While most people have faith in your ability to administer the kingdom in Mordred's place, many felt that Arthur was a great leader and that he should continue to hold power in the realm. Perhaps it would be better to leave the regency to him?
Arthur would be a much better ruler than I ever could.
We have no need for Arthur. I will stave off the Saxons myself!

Recognizing your military prowess and ability to unite the kingdom against the Saxons, [From.GetTitledName] has offered to make you regent of Dumnonia. While Mordred is still technically the king, many hope that you will be able to lead the kingdom against its many enemies and restore its strength and prosperity.

Recognizing your military prowess and ability to unite the kingdom against the Saxons, [From.GetTitledName] has offered to make you regent of Dumnonia once more. While Mordred is still technically the king, many hope that you will be able once again to lead the kingdom against its many enemies and restore its strength and prosperity.
It is for the good of the kingdom.

Your current regent has stepped aside to allow Arthur to become regent of Dumnonia. Known as a great warrior from his campaigns against the Franks and Saxons, Arthur could be key to holding off the Saxons to the east, yet as the son of Uther he has a claim to the throne, and many think that Arthur, not you, should be the king...

Your current regent has stepped aside to allow Arthur to become regent of Dumnonia once more. Many see him as the realm's saviour and Arthur could indeed be key to holding off the Saxons to the east, yet his claim to the throne could still be problematic...
A great warrior, perhaps, but is he plotting for my throne?

The current regent of Dumnonia has stepped aside to allow Arthur to gain control of Dumnonia. Known as a great warrior from his campaigns against the Franks and Saxons, Arthur could be key to holding off the Saxons to the east that seek to conquer our lands. As the son of Uther, he has a claim to the throne, yet he seems to show no ambition to take it from Mordred...

The current regent of Dumnonia has stepped aside to allow Arthur to retake control of Dumnonia. Many see him as the realm's saviour and Arthur could indeed be key to holding off the Saxons to the east that seek to conquer our lands. As the son of Uther, he has a claim to the throne, yet he seems to continue to show no ambition to take it from Mordred...
Arthur will save us from the Saxons!
The Wolftails

Under the guidance of Merlin and the training of Hywel, Derfel Cadarn has grown to be quite a capable warrior. Honest and loyal, he is devoted to your cause and would make a great general in the fight against [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s enemies. If we make him a lord of his own band of warriors he could be a useful vassal and ally against the Saxons.
I will grant him a band of warriors as his own.
He does not deserve such an honour yet.
The Wolftails

Impressed by your skills as a warrior, [From.GetTitledName] has decided to grant you a band of warriors to call your own. Using the tails of wolves attached to your helmets as an emblem, you have decided to name your new band "The Wolftails", one that will in time surely strike fear into the hearts of Anglo-Saxons everywhere.
I will serve Arthur loyally and well!
The Wolftails

Your uncle and regent, [From.GetTitledName], has decided to grant the young but skilled Derfel Cadarn his own band of warriors and make him a lord. This new band, which calls itself "The Wolftails", has sworn fealty to you and will fight for you in your wars, but Derfel's true loyalties have always lied with Arthur.

Your regent, [From.GetTitledName] has decided to grant young but skilled Derfel Cadarn his own band of warriors and make him a lord. This new band, which calls itself "The Wolftails", has sworn fealty to you and will fight for you in your wars, but Derfel's true loyalties have always lied with Arthur...
A band of noble warriors... or a tool for Arthur to gain my throne?

[d_wolftails.Holder.GetTitledName] has declared that the oaths of fealty [d_wolftails.Holder.GetSheHe] and [d_wolftails.Holder.GetHerHis] warriors once swore have expired, and that the Wolftails will no longer owe fealty to the Kings of Dumnonia. From this day on the Wolftails will be a free company, ready to fight for any British kingdom that will hire them.
A sad day for [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
The Rise of Arthur

After the death of his father Uther, your friend and patron Arthur returned to Dumnonia to become regent for his young nephew Mordred. In need of experienced warriors to defend the realm against his many enemies, he has invited you and your band of horsemen to join him in Dumnonia to help him fulfill his oath to protect the kingdom.

After the death of his father Uther, your friend and patron Arthur returned to Dumnonia to become its new king. In need of experienced warriors to defend the realm against his many enemies, he has invited you and your band of horsemen to join him in Dumnonia to help him fulfill his oath to protect the kingdom.
I will join my friend and help him however I can!
I will pursue my own destiny away from Dumnonia.
The Brotherhood Horsemen

Sagramor, the famed Numidian warrior and your close friend during your campaigns in Armorica, has come to [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] with his powerful band of horsemen. The Brotherhood Horsemen have sworn fealty to [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] and are promising to help you in whatever way they can in the fight against [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s enemies.

Sagramor, the famed Numidian warrior and your close friend during your campaigns in Armorica, has come to [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] with his powerful band of horsemen. The Brotherhood Horsemen have sworn fealty to you and are promising to help you in whatever way they can in the fight against [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s enemies.
Excellent! Together we will drive the Saxons out of Britannia!
The Brotherhood Horsemen

Sagramor, the famed Numidian warrior and your regent Arthur's close friend, has come to [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] with his powerful band of horsemen. The Brotherhood Horsemen have sworn fealty to you and will fight for you in your wars, but Sagramor's true loyalties have always lied with Arthur...
A band of noble warriors... or a plot of Arthur to gain my throne?

[d_brotherhood_horsemen.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] has announced that the Brotherhood Horsemen's time in service to Dumnonia has come to and end, and that [d_brotherhood_horsemen.Holder.GetHerHis] company of warriors will now return to their old status adventuring around the island. From this day on the Brotherhood Horsemen will be a free company, ready to fight for any British kingdom that will hire them.
Dumnonia owes them much.
Arthur, the Imperator

A wave of cheers and shouts ring through the crowds of [Root.Location.GetName] as your vassals acclaim you as the true ruler of Dumnonia. Though you shun the title of King that your father and nephew once held, your vassals still quietly call you one, and your closest entourage see fit to view you as Imperator of southern Britain, a worthy successor to the glory of Romans before you.
There are some who still view Mordred as King, though.
The Decline of Dumnonia

King Uther of Dumnonia has died, bringing his long and prosperous reign to a close. The former High King led the Britons against the advance of the Anglo-Saxons and greatly expanded his kingdom to the east, subjugating the heirs of the Atrebates, Belgae, and Dobunni, and bringing hope to the beleagured land once more.\n\nHis death without an heir, however, has left the kingdom divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, claiming that their oaths of fealty were to Uther and Uther only. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

Arthur Pendragon, King of Dumnonia and the hero of the Britons, is dead. Seen by many as Britannia's best hope against the Saxons, the bastard son of Uther struggled against a myriad of external enemies and his own personal troubles to preserve the realm his father had fought hard to build.\n\nWith the great king's final breath, however, the kingdom has been left divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

Mordred, King of Dumnonia, is dead. Ascending the throne from a young age after the untimely demise of his father, his early reign was marked by infighting between those who supported and resented Arthur's influence over the regency and the constant invasions of the Saxons.\n\nStill, many respected Mordred's position as Uther's only legitimate heir, and the kingdom managed to hold itself together throughout his reign. Now, the kingdom has been left divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetKingQueen] of Dumnonia, has died. As the [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the great king Uther, [Root.GetSheHe] fought hard against internal divisions and the invasions of the Saxons to preserve [Root.GetHerHis] father's kingdom. \n\nWith [Root.GetFirstName]'s demise and the fading of Uther's legacy, the kingdom has been left divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

King Uther of Dumnonia has been cast from his throne, bringing his long and prosperous reign to a close. The former High King led the Britons against the advance of the Anglo-Saxons and greatly expanded his kingdom to the east, subjugating the heirs of the Atrebates, Belgae, and Dobunni, and bringing hope to the beleagured land once more.\n\nUther's deposition, however, has left the kingdom in chaos. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, claiming that their oaths of fealty were to Uther and Uther only. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

The great hero of the Britons, Arthur Pendragon, has been deposed from his throne. Seen by many as Britannia's best hope against the Saxons, the bastard son of Uther struggled against a myriad of external enemies and his own personal troubles to preserve the realm his father had fought hard to build.\n\nThe downfall of Arthur, however, has left the kingdom in chaos. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

His hold on power never fully certain, King Mordred of Dumnonia has been deposed. Ascending the throne from a young age after the untimely demise of his father, his early reign was marked by infighting between those who supported and resented Arthur's influence over the regency and the constant invasions of hte Saxons.\n\nStill, many respected Mordred's position as Uther's only legitimate heir. Now, the kingdom has been left in chaos, with its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetKingQueen] of Dumnonia, has been unseated from his throne. As the [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the great king Uther, [Root.GetSheHe] fought hard against internal divisions and the invasions of the Saxons to preserve [Root.GetHerHis] father's kingdom. \n\nWith [Root.GetFirstName]'s demise and the fading of Uther's legacy, the kingdom has been left divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?
Dumnonia must prevail!
Will we have our freedom again?
Who will hold back the barbarians now?
Nobody can stop us now!
This is interesting news...
Death of Arthur

Arthur Pendragon, King of Dumnonia and the High King of the Britons, is dead. Seen by many as Britannia's best hope against the Saxons, the bastard son of Uther struggled against a myriad of external enemies and his own personal troubles to preserve the realm his father had fought hard to build, finally managing to unite the Britons under his banner to present a unified resistance against hte Germanic invaders.\n\nArthur's death spells the end of an era for the Britons. Will anybody be able to live up to the great King's legacy? Or will the Britons be doomed to a future of infighting, defeat, and subjugation, as the Anglo-Saxons seek to expand their realms once more?
I will make Arthur proud!
A great man and hero is dead.
The age of the Britons is over!
This is interesting news...

As regent, most of Dumnonia supports you, but not all. The right marriage will shore up your position at court, and especially among the other kings who still eye Dumnonia for themselves. Princess Ceinwyn, the Star of Powys, is the logical choice, cementing an alliance with Gorfyddyd, the powerful King of Powys. But Princess Guinevere of the lost kingdom, Henis Wyren, radiates an aura of destiny. She will marry a great man, and thinks you are one, despite your bastardry. Will you put the interests of Dumnonia aside, for a woman who sets your heart aflame?
I love the brilliant, bewitching Guinevere. She must be my bride.
I can suffer the beautiful and kind Ceinwyn, for Britannia.
§Y[This.GetTitledName]§! and §Y[Root.Liege.GetTitledName]§! sign a non-aggression pact.

In a surprising move, the famed warrior Arthur, [Root.GetArthurTitle], has announced his marriage to your courtier Guinevere, daughter of the dispossessed King Leodegan of Henis Wyren. Apparently, he spurned many other more wealthy and connected princesses for this choice, so great was his his love and yearning for Guinevere.

The great Arthur might be unparalleled among men, but he has never faced a woman like yourself versed in the ways of romance and seduction. Indeed, a smile here, a wink there, and now Arthur is practically begging you to marry him.
My blessings to the newlyweds, I suppose.
I see greatness in Arthur. We will share it together.
He lacks in ambition. I can do better.

You have tried everything you can think of, made every tearful plea your mouth will produce, but still the beautiful Guinevere resolutely refuses to take your hand in marriage. It seems that despite all she has done to attract your attention and pull at your heart, she has simply lost interest in you.
But... but why?

You were shocked when Ceinwyn ran off and disappeared at her wedding - you had always known that she was stubborn, but not that she was capable of something like this! Now, you have heard that she has eloped with Derfel Cadarn, one of Arthur's soldiers in Dumnonia, pledging to never formally marry but to live with him as husband and wife.

From the moment you first saw Derfel Cadarn you knew you two were meant to be together. Your father may have had other plans for you, but no matter - all it took was a bit of running off to elope with your love. A princess can't exactly marry a lowly soldier, but that doesn't mean you can't still spend the rest of your life with him...
Well, that was a surprise.
We will be together for all time.
She did what?!? How could my Ceinwyn do this?!?

You always did know that your courtier Derfel was in love with Ceinwyn, the Princess of Powys, but never did you think anything would come of it. So you were very surprised when she suddenly appeared in your court without warning with Derfel, and even more so when word got to you they had apparently pledged to spend the rest of their lives together.

You were in love the moment you laid your eyes on her, but you knew that a lowly soldier like you never had a chance with the brilliant Ceinwyn, the Star of Powys. Yet you never gave up hope, and apparently Ceinwyn thought the same... and now she has run off to elope with you, pledging to be at your side forever.
A fine catch, Derfel. I am impressed.
You... you really did it!

A diplomat from Arthur, [Root.GetArthurTitle] and hero of the Britons, has arrived in your court asking for the hand in marriage of your [GetFromRelation] Ceinwyn, Princess of Powys. He offers an alliance between the two leading kingdoms of Britannia to fight against the Saxons together, and promises to treat her with the utmost love and respect deserving of a princess.

A diplomat from Arthur, [Root.GetArthurTitle] and hero of the Britons, has arrived in your court asking for your hand in marriage, wishing to cement an alliance between Powys and Dumnonia against the Saxons. While he isn't quite the man that you truly love in your heart, his honour and integrity is second to none and you know that he can truly be trusted.
A worthy husband for my Star.
§Y[This.GetTitledName]§! and §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! sign a non-aggression pact.
I suppose I could do much worse than Arthur.
No. He's just not the right man.

Your regent, Arthur, has announced his marriage to Ceinwyn, the Princess of Powys, sealing an alliance between Dumnonia and [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Arthur and [From.GetTitledFirstName] have expressed their hope that this new alliance between the two former rivals will enable the Britons to form a united front against the Saxons.
But is the alliance with me, or with Arthur?
§Y[From.GetTitledName]§! and §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! sign a non-aggression pact.
You were somewhat surprised to receive a polite, but firm, statement from [From.GetBestName] refusing your offer of a marriage alliance. Apparently, [From.GetSheHe] has 'other plans'.
A pity. It would have brought peace to Britannia.

During a visit to your court, Lancelot, [Root.GetLancelotStatus], seems to have been quickly enamoured with your courtier Guinevere, daughter of the dispossessed King Leodegan of Henis Wyren. Somewhat to your surprise, the proud and haughty princess seems to have been quite receptive, and after spending a number of days courting each other the two have announced their marriage.

You were somewhat disappointed when Arthur married Ceinwyn - despite clearly having shown interest in you - but that all disappeared when you met Lancelot, [Root.GetLancelotStatus]. He may not quite be Arthur's equal and his claims of greateness are slightly suspect, but his ambition and haughty disposition definitely makes up for it.
Good for them.
Together, we will rule Britannia...

You didn't really think he would ever find a woman he deemed worthy enough to marry him, but while on a visit to the court of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], your [GetFromRelation] Lancelot seems to have fallen in love with Guinevere, daughter of the dispossessed King Leodegan of Henis Wyren. It seems that the feeling was mutual, and now the two have now announced their marriage to each other.

While visiting the court of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], a beautiful woman catches your eye. She introduces herself as Guinevere, princess of Henis Wyren, and smiles at you, saying that she has been waiting a long time for a man as great and ambitious as you. She emits an aura of beauty, passion, and ambition, and immediately you know you are meant for each other.
Congratulations, I suppose.
Marry me, Guinevere.

Since Arthur's marriage you have noticed that your [GetFromRelation] Derfel being more sullen than usual, seemingly heartbroken. While you're not quite sure why he has become like this, he seems to be consoling himself in the company of his old friend Nimue, and two have become increasingly close over the last few days.

Watching Ceinwyn get married was painful, but you consoled yourself in the knowledge that she would be well cared for in Arthur's hands. As you mourn the loss of your secret love, you find yourself spending more and more time with your old friend Nimue... perhaps she is the one who is truly meant for you?
Good for him, I guess.
I do think we should be together more...

Recently you have noticed your courtier Nimue spending more and more time in the company of [FromFrom.GetBestName]. While you know that they have been friends since childhood, it seems that the two have become rather close as of late, perhaps more than just friends...

Recently your friend Derfel has been spending more and more time with you, heartbroken over Ceinwyn's marriage to Arthur. While you have known each other since you were little in Merlin's tower, you and Derfel are no longer children, and as you get close to him you can feel something more stirring within you...
Well, good for them.
Let us be together under the Gods, Derfel...
Married to a Macsen daughter
My wife is a direct female descendant of the great Imperator, Magnus Maximus, once ruler of all of Britain and Gaul. Through her, I can legitimise my own claim to this land.
Excellent

To the great and most loyal [Root.GetTitledName],

A province divided against itself will never stand in this dark and dangerous world. For the surival of our civilization, it is essential that a single central authority be established for all of Britannia. I trust that you understand why this is necessary.

Signed, [From.GetTitledName]
Very well then. We shall place our faith in you.
If [From.GetTitledName] successfully claims the Imperial crown:
This is going too far! We will not suffer the Roman yoke again!

Fight for your independence along with the other rebelling Subject Kingdoms. If victorious, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will be forced to relinquish the High Kingship for good, and will never be allowed to reclaim it. If defeated, you will be forced to relinquish any royal titles and become a vassal of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s new Imperium Britanniarum.

To the [GetRootFromCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

While it saddens me to accept your difficult demands, I understand the need for this in these trying times. I place my trust in your skill and wisdom and hope that you will be able to lead our island to a brighter future.

Signed, [From.GetTitledName]
Excellent.

To the [GetFromRootInsult] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

Your 'proposal' is nothing more than a selfish power grab to claim the Imperial crown, then march on Gaul and abandon Britannia to its fate once more. The likes of you will never hold power in this proud land again!

Signed, [From.GetTitledName]
Then war it shall be!
Imperium Britanniarum

Many assumed that Roman rule in Britannia was over after the withdrawal of the legions and the fragmentation of the island after the expulsion of Roman magistrates in 409. However, against all odds [Root.GetFullName] has managed to defeat [Root.GetHerHis] rivals and unite most of the former province under [Root.GetHerHis] rule to proclaim himself Imperator in the new Imperial palace of [Root.Capital.GetName].\n\nThe new Imperator has vowed to restore order and prosperity to the island and has already hinted at designs to restore order in the increasingly chaotic Gallic provinces. Will this new emperor be able to defeat the barbarian hordes and restore the old Imperial order over the West?
Britannia shall not fall! Long live the empire!
All rebels have their §YKingdom§! and §YHigh Kingdom§! tier titles forfeit.
And the Roman yoke returns once more.
All §YKingdom§! and §YHigh Kingdom§! tier titles are forfeit.
Let us hope that [Root.GetSheHe] lives up to [Root.GetHerHis] promises.
Long live the empire!
Long live the empire?
And another usurper rises.
This is interesting news...
Formalization of the High Kingship

The concept of a High King ruling over all of Britannia is deeply entrenched, but the need for a king to prove himself before even attempting to be recognized has long prevented any sort of continuity from being established. However, over the last many decades, many of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty have managed to claim the High Kingship, and now [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] scions are increasingly seen as natural candidates for the High Kingship. \n\nNow, [Root.GetTitledName] has issued a decree forbidding the vacancy of the throne of Britannia, and has forced all the other kings to swear fealty to [Root.GetHerHis] heir as the next High King. Time will tell if the High King's authority survives [Root.GetTitledName]'s passing, but the fragmented Brythonic kingdoms have taken their first tentative step towards a unified state.
For the good of Britannia.
They have much more to do to prove themselves...
This is interesting news...
The Royal Mint of Britannia

In an effort to revive economic and trade links depressed since the end of Roman rule in Britain, [Root.GetTitledName] has announced the establishment of a new mint in [Root.GetHerHis] capital of [Root.Capital.GetName], minting coins in the name of the High King to be issued across the island.\n\nTo fund the workings of the mint - also doubling as a confederal treasury - the other subject kings have also agreed to contribute a part of their income, with the understanding that the return of a steady supply of coinage to Britannia will bring back a degree of prosperity largely lacking since the end of Roman rule across the entire island.
For the good of Britannia.
This had better be worth it.
This is interesting news...

To the great and most loyal [Root.GetTitledName],

I have asked the High Council of Britannia to consider a significant strengthening of its powers over each of the individual kingdoms. I trust that you understand why a strong central authority to resist the Saxon threat is necessary.

Signed, [From.GetTitledName]
Very well then. The Council will have its say.
If [From.GetTitledName] is successful in passing the decree:
You have no right to do this! This is going too far!

Join the revolt along with the other rebelling Subject Kingdoms. If victorious, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will be forced to withdraw the decree and abdicate the throne, but if defeated all the Subject Kingdoms will become a vassal of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and you will be taken prisoner.

To the [GetRootFromCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

Your proposals are sensible and farsighted. I approve of this decree and look forward to participating in the empowered Council, and wish you luck against your inevitable opponents.

Signed, [From.GetTitledName]
Excellent. You will be well awarded.

To the [GetFromRootInsult] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

Your 'proposal' is nothing more than a selfish power grab to trample on our ancient rights and seize our thrones from underneath us. I will never accept your illegitimate authority as long as I live!

Signed, [From.GetTitledName]
Then war it is!
The High Council of Britannia

At the direction of [Root.GetTitledName] the High Council of Britannia has passed a motion greatly expanding its authority over its constituent kingdoms. Formerly a mostly powerless body, the Council now has the power to pass laws, collect taxes, and coordinate military movements over all of Brythonic kingdoms in the name of the High King. \n\nWith the remaining rebel holdouts now defeated, [Root.GetTitledName] now stands with an authority over all of Britannia not seen since the end of Roman rule. It remains to be seen if the High King will be able to use [Root.GetHerHis] new authority to finally vanquish the invaders of the beleagured island, or if will Britons fall again to infighting as with many times before.
For the good of Britannia.
This will not stand!
We will stand at the council as equals.
Long live Britannia!
This is interesting news...
The Archbishopric of Londinium
The Britannic State Church

In a grand ceremony headed by [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] [Root.RelHead.GetHerselfHimself], the newly restored Londinium cathedral was officially re-consecrated as the seat of the revived Archbishopric of Londinium. As the new Metropolitan and Primate of Britannia, all [Root.Religion.GetName] clerics in Britannia will officially answer to the Archbishop.\n\nThis act reunites the many fragmented dioceses of Britannia under a single authority under the sponsorship and protection of [Root.GetTitledName]. While still officially independent of the state, this will greatly increase the [Root.GetTitle]'s influence over the church and clergy of Britannia, and they will be sure to defend and uphold the the legitimacy of the High Kingship.

[Root.GetTitledName] has gathered all the most important [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s of Britannia in a great synod to organize the [Root.Religion.GetName] church of Britannia. Under the oversight of [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] [Root.RelHead.GetHerselfHimself], the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s have formalized the religious hierarchy within Britannia, with the High King's [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] as his formal representative.\n\nWhile still officially independent of the state, this council informally unites the [Root.Religion.GetName] church in Britannia under the sponsorship and protection of [Root.GetTitledName]. In return, this will greatly increase the [Root.GetTitle]'s influence over the spiritual doings of the Britons, and the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s will be sure to defend and uphold the the legitimacy of the High Kingship.

[Root.GetTitledName] has gathered all the most important [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s of Britannia in a great synod to organize the [Root.Religion.GetName] church of Britannia. Led by the High King's [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledName], the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s have agreed to the formation of a permanent church council under High King's [Root.GetLordSpiritualName]'s leadership.\n\nWhile still officially independent of the state, this council informally unites the [Root.Religion.GetName] church in Britannia under the sponsorship and protection of [Root.GetTitledName]. In return, this will greatly increase the [Root.GetTitle]'s influence over the spiritual doings of the Britons, and the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s will be sure to defend and uphold the the legitimacy of the High Kingship.
For the good of Britannia.
But where is my place in all this?
This is interesting news...
The Britannic Succession

Seeking to diminish the influence of the electoral council, [Root.GetTitledName] has instituted laws establishing the election and investiture of [Root.GetHerHis] chosen successor during [Root.GetHerHis] reign to secure the traditionally elective succession from a position of strength. By reducing the election to a mere formality, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has effectively arranged for the succession to fall to [Root.GetHerHis] heirs of the blood. \n\nWhile a controversial move disempowering the vassal kings of their traditional prerogatives, [Root.GetTitledName] is clear that this will set a precedent ending the unpredictable maneuvering and horse-trading that used to mark the succession, and securing the High Kingship within the dynasty.
For the good of Britannia.
Merely a formality anyways.
This is interesting news...
The Lex Britanniorum

Under the direction of [Root.GetTitledName], the scribes of [Root.Capital.GetName] have published the Lex Britanniorum, an authoritative codification of the legal customs of the British. The code largely standardizes and does away with the patchwork of local customs and confusing mix of Celtic and Roman law until recently dominant on the island, though not without some protest from those who resent the revokation of their local legal customs and traditions. Copies of the text are already being sent to the kings and courts of Britannia, along with an official decree superseding it over all the previous unwritten customs once used to rule the land - and implictly establishing the right of the High King and his council to legislate for the realm as a whole.
For the good of Britannia.
I suppose this will make judging easier.
This is interesting news...
The Heir of Caratacus

Once, the Britons seemed on the verge of greatness. The island seemed poised for unification under the great kings Cunobelinus and Caratacus, until the faithful invasion of Tiberius destroyed all that. The Romans have since left but the Britons have remained, fighting to defend, rebuild, and finally reunite the country of their forebears under British rule.\n\nNow, [Root.GetTitledName] has declared [Root.GetHerHis] intention to fulfill the ultimate ambitions of the Britons and unite all the Celts under [Root.GetHerHis] banner - from the tribes of the Picts and Scots to the kingdoms of Armorica. Never before has a single king ever ruled over all of the Britannic Isles - will [Root.GetTitledFirstName] succeed where even the Roman emperors failed, or will [Root.GetHerHis] ambition prove to be [Root.GetHerHis] empire's undoing?
May the spirit of Britannia live forever!
Long live the High King! Long live Britannia!
And the barbarians show their true colours.
Who does [Root.GetSheHe] think [Root.GetSheHe] is?!?
This is interesting news...
The Senate of [Root.Capital.GetName]

The Romans citizens of Britannia, largely left to fend for themselves by their brothers on the continent, have against all odds managed to defend their lands and reunite their provinces under a single authority. Claiming to be the only true heirs of the Western Roman Empire unsullied by the barbarian invaders, [Root.GetTitledName] has denied the legitimacy of the barbarian-controlled Senate in Rome and announced the formation of a rival Senate in [Root.Capital.GetName], extending gifts and invitations to Roman nobles from across the west to take their seats in this new 'restored' Senate. While many disparage the move as little more than a nostalgic waste of gold, others suggest that [Root.GetSheHe] might have less sentimental motives - perhaps setting the stage for an assumption of the Imperial Crown...
This Rome shall not fall again...
The spirit of Rome endures!
And to think we were done with the Romans...
Perhaps there is some civilization there after all?
This is interesting news...

To the great and most loyal [Root.GetTitledName],

A strong leader is what Britannia needs to reach its full potential and restore the civilization to the fallen provinces of the continent. I have prepared a number of decrees to restore an Imperial system of government in Britannia and restore the Empire, and while I know it is difficult I hope you will accept them.

Signed, [From.GetTitledName]
Very well. For the empire!:

If [From.GetTitledName] successfully claims the Imperial crown, the §Y[e_britannia.GetFullBaseName]§! will be abolished and replaced with the §Y[e_roman_britannia.GetFullBaseName]§!, restoring an §YImperial§! government over Britannia.:
This is going too far! We will not suffer the Roman yoke again!

Join the revolt along with the other rebelling Subject Kingdoms. If victorious, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will be forced to withdraw his claim to the empire, abolish the Senate, and abdicate the throne, but if defeated, you will be forced to relinquish any royal titles and be taken prisoner by the new Imperator.

To the [GetRootFromCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

While it saddens me to accept your difficult demands, I understand why such reforms are necessary. I will abide by your decrees and place my trust in your skill and wisdom. Long live the empire!

Signed, [From.GetTitledName]
Excellent.

To the [GetFromRootInsult] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

This insidious attempt to suppress our ancient rights and revive the Roman yoke will not be tolerated. I will never accept your illegitimate authority as long as I live!

Signed, [From.GetTitledName]
Then war it will be!
Imperium Britanniarum

Many assumed that Roman rule in Britannia was over after the withdrawal of the legions and the fragmentation of the island after the expulsion of Roman magistrates in 409. However, High King [Root.GetFirstName] had always harboured ambitions to revive Imperial rule to the island and now, after a vicious civil war against opponents of the move, [Root.GetSheHe] has managed to proclaim [Root.GetHerselfHimself] Imperator in the new Imperial palace of [Root.Capital.GetName].\n\nThe new Imperator has vowed to restore the provinces of Britannia to their former glory and has already hinted at designs to restore order in the fallen provinces of the continent. Will this new emperor be able to defeat the barbarian hordes and restore the old Imperial order over the West?
Britannia shall not fall! Long live the empire!
And the Roman yoke returns once more.
All §YKingdom§! tier titles are forfeit.
Long live the empire!
Long live the empire?
And another usurper rises.
This is interesting news...

An emissary has arrived from [britannia_high_king.GetTitledName]. [britannia_high_king.GetSheHeCap] congratulates you on your assumption of the throne and wishes you a long and prosperous reign, but also reminds you of your obligations towards [britannia_high_king.GetHerHim] as the rightful High King of Britannia.
But of course we will recognize you.
I bow to no king. Not even this one.
[britannia_high_king.GetTitledName] might declare war to force you to submit.

One of your Subject Kings has been forced to abdicate the throne. [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] successor [From.GetTitledFirstName], the new [From.GetKingQueen] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], has sent an emissary recognizing you as the High King and officially affirming that [From.GetSheHe] will continue [From.GetHerHis] predecessor's policy of recognizing you as suzerain.
Excellent. A wise move.

One of your Subject Kings has been forced to abdicate the throne. [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] successor [From.GetTitledFirstName], the new [From.GetKingQueen] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], has rebuffed your diplomats and emissaries, asserting [From.GetHerHis] independence and refusing to recognize you as suzerain.
We shall show [From.GetHerHim] some steel, then.
We'll deal with [From.GetHerHim] later.
High Kingdom of Britannia

[From.GetTitledName] has proclaimed himself worthy of the title of High King of the Britons, but his legitimacy depends on the consensus of the other Kings. Will you support [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s claim to the throne and recognize him as rightful High King of Britannia?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] is a great leader. I will support his cause.
I will bow to no King. Not even this King.
Let him be High King. But I will not be one of his vassals.

Great [Root.GetTitledName], I have taken your claim into consideration and decided to grant you my support and recognition as High King of Britannia. I am ready to swear fealty to you and become your loyal vassal. May your rule be a long and prosperous one.

Respectfully,
[From.GetTitledName]
Very good. You have made the right choice.

My [Root.GetTitle], I have taken your request into consideration, and I respectfully inform you that I will not support your claim to the High Kingdom of Britannia.
You lack the skills and wisdom necessary to hold such a prestigious throne.

Please renounce all your claims,
[From.GetTitledName]
I understand... and I will renounce my claim. For now.
I am confident we will come to a mutually beneficial agreement...
Perhaps some steel will convince you...

Great [Root.GetTitledName], I have considered your claim and decided to grant you my recognition as High King. However, I refuse to swear fealty to you and to become de facto one of your vassal kings. The [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] will retain its independence.

Respectfully,
[From.GetTitledName]
Good enough. Formal recognition is all I really need.

Not all of the other kings have accepted your claim to the High Kingship. An alliance of other princes opposed to your claim has gathered under the leadership of [HK_opponent_leader.GetTitledName] and is threatening war if you do not drop your pretentions to the High Kingship.
I will renounce my claim. For now.
Then war it is!

If victorious, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will be proclaimed High King of Britannia, with all the opposing kings becoming Subject Kingdoms.\nIf defeated, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will lose every right to the High Kingdom, and will never be allowed to reclaim it.

It seems that your grand ambition of becoming High King of all the Britons was not to be. Humiliated and defeated on the battlefield, any credibility you may have had in claiming supremacy over the other kings now lies in pieces, and as the price for your freedom you have been forced to take a vow never to try to claim the High Kingship ever again.

The upstart [From.GetTitledName] has been defeated, [From.GetHerHis] dream of becoming High King lying in tatters before you. As the price for [From.GetHerHis] freedom, [From.GetTitledName] has humbly vowed to forever give up his claim to the High Kingship and never again challenge your independence.

[From.GetTitledName] has been defeated on the battlefield by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [FromFrom.GetHerHis] coalition of opposing kings, forever ending [From.GetHerHis] ambition to be crowned High King of Britannia. It seems that the Kings of the Britons will remain independent and divided, for now.
I have failed...
The Gods did not deem [From.GetHerHim] worthy.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] did not deem [From.GetHerHim] worthy.
This is interesting news...
High Kingdom of Britannia

The kings of Britain have declared their unanimous support to [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s claim to the High Kingdom of Britannia, and crowned him High King in the Great Hall of [From.Capital.GetName].

Some of the kings will swear fealty to [From.GetTitledFirstName] and rule their homelands as vassal kings under his rule from now on.

Others, despite their support to the coronation, will not agree to become de facto vassals of another king and will maintain their formal independence.
Hail to [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
Excellent!
This is interesting news...
The Brotherhood of Britain

[Root.GetTitledName] has summoned the bravest and most loyal warriors of the British Isles and united them under the banners of the 'Brotherhood of Britain'.

Each man in this great company of warriors has swore fealty to [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and taken an oath to always fight for the High Kings of Britannia against foreign invaders.

If ever granted independence, the men of the Brotherhood of Britain will fight honorably for any Briton or Romano-British king defending his realm against Germanic or Imperial enemies, and will never ask for gold in return.
Excellent.
This is interesting news...
High Kingdom of Britannia

The throne of the High King of Britannia is currently held by a ruler who is not considered worthy of the title.

Without the support of his vassal kings, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has been declared unfit for the ancient and prestigious seat, and from this moment will no longer be recognized as High King of Britannia.

All former subject kingdoms of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will regain formal independence.
This is unacceptable!
A [This.GetTitle] bends [This.GetHerHis] knee to no one.
No lesser ruler can be High King...
This is interesting news...
All §YSubject Kingdoms§! will break free from your rule.
Death of the High King

[Root.GetTitledName], High King of the Britons, has died. The High Kingship lies vacant once more, as only a king who has proven himself worthy in the eyes of all the other kings could hope to claim authority over all of Britannia.\n\nWith the High King dead, the various kingdoms of the Britons have reasserted their full independence, petty squabbles and rivalries already resurfacing between them. Only time will tell if another king will be able to rise up above the fray and unite the isle once more.
In time, I too will be High King...
Who will protect Britannia now?
Excellent.
This is interesting news...
Fall of the High King

The reign of High King [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName] has ended, and with it [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] hegenomy over the other Brythonic kingdoms. Already many of the other kings have refused to renew their oaths, claiming that their oaths were personally to High King [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName] and [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] alone.\n\nWithout the support of the other kings, the High Kingship has been declared vacant, with all former subject kingdoms regaining their full independence. Only time will tell if another king will be able to rise up above the fray and unite the isle once more.
[FromFromFrom.GetSheHe] did not deserve the honour anyways.
Their treachery shall not be forgotten...
Who will protect Britannia now?
Yes, let them fight among themselves...
This is interesting news...

The reign of High King [FromFromFromFrom.GetFirstName] has ended, and with it [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHis] hegenomy over the other Brythonic kingdoms. Already many of the other kings have refused to renew their oaths, claiming that their oaths were personally to High King [FromFromFromFrom.GetFirstName] and [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] alone.\n\nWithout the support of the other kings, the High Kingship has been declared vacant, with all former subject kingdoms regaining their full independence. Only time will tell if another king will be able to rise up above the fray and unite the isle once more.
Their treachery shall not be forgotten...

You have received word that [From.GetTitledName] has proclaimed himself worthy of the title of High King of the Britons. His legitimacy depends on the consensus of the other Kings, and if he is to unite the Britons under a single banner he will have to gain their approval - by diplomacy or force.
[From.GetSheHeCap] will need my consent to move forwards...
Will he finally bring unity to the land?
United or not, we will still crush them...
This is interesting news...
[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has publicly announced his support for [From.GetTitledName] to be crowned High King of Britannia, giving his claim a major boost.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has publicly announced his support for [From.GetTitledName] to be crowned High King of Britannia, but has also asserted that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will remain sovereign in [FromFrom.GetHerHis] current kingdom.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has publicly announced his opposition to the elevation of [From.GetTitledName] to the High Kingship. [From.GetTitledName] has yet to respond to [FromFrom.GetHerHis] refusal, but many believe that [From.GetSheHe] may be preparing for war.
This is interesting news...

It seems that [From.GetTitledFirstName] did not have the support [From.GetSheHe] thought [From.GetSheHe] had when claiming the High Kinship. Unwilling to challenge the alliance of opposing kings on the field of battle, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has quietly dropped his claim for the High Kingship for the time being.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has not taken lightly to the refusals of some of the other kings to accept [From.GetHerHis] claim. In response, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has declared war on all of the opposing kings, proclaiming that this dispute will be settled on the field of battle.
This is interesting news...
Only the greatest and most prestigious Briton rulers can claim the title of §YHigh King of Britannia§!, and only if they have the unanimous support of the other Briton kings.
